patterns: What are the consequences of academic dishonesty in this course?
What is the definition of plagiarism in this course?
Can I collaborate with other students on assignments in this course?
What should I do if I suspect a fellow student of academic dishonesty?
Is it acceptable to copy material from online sources for assignments in this course?
What should I do if I accidentally plagiarize in an assignment?
What does the university policy say about academic honesty?
How will I know if my work is considered plagiarism in this course?
What are the penalties for academic dishonesty in this course?
Can I use work I completed for a different course in an assignment for this course?
What if I accidentally include another student's work in my assignment?
How can I ensure that I am not plagiarizing in my assignments?
What are the consequences of failing to properly cite sources in my assignments?
Is it okay to discuss the assignments with other students?
What is the difference between collaboration and collusion in this course?
How can I avoid unintentional plagiarism in my assignments?
What happens if I am caught plagiarizing in this course?
What is the penalty for collusion in this course?
How will I be graded if I am found guilty of academic dishonesty in this course?
What is the role of the instructor in cases of academic dishonesty?
Are there any exceptions to the academic honesty policy for this course?
What is the process for reporting suspected cases of academic dishonesty?
What is the definition of collusion in this course?
What happens if I forget to cite a source in my assignment?
What is the purpose of the academic honesty policy for this course?
Can I ask for help from other students on assignments for this course?
What constitutes as plagiarism in this course?
Is it okay to use material from other courses for assignments in this course?
How can I protect my work from being copied by other students?
What should I do if I find out that someone has copied my work?
What is the instructor's role in preventing academic dishonesty in this course?
What is the university's stance on academic dishonesty?
What are the expectations for academic honesty in this course?
What is the procedure for appealing a penalty for academic dishonesty in this course?
How can I report academic dishonesty in this course while protecting my anonymity?
responses: The academic honesty policy for the course requires that all projects submitted must be original work and prohibits copying from other sources. Collaboration is allowed but must be clearly credited, and failure to do so is considered plagiarism. Cases of dishonesty will be handled according to university policy. Students are responsible for taking reasonable precautions to protect their work, and turning in someone else's code is considered collusion and will result in a failing grade for all involved parties.

What topics will we cover?

What is the role of PyTorch in deep learning?
What are some of the deep learning techniques we will learn in CS 472?
Will we be introduced to GANs in this course?
What is the importance of attention in deep learning?
Will we be learning about diffusion models in this course?
What is the relevance of diffusion models in deep learning?
What is the focus of the first week of CS 472?
What are some of the topics covered in week 3 of CS 472?
What is the focus of week 6 in CS 472?
What are the key takeaways from the week 8 lectures?
Can you tell me what content we will learn?
responses: In CS 472, students will learn about deep learning techniques, how to use PyTorch, Generative Adversarial Networks (GANs), Attention and Transformers, Variational Autoencoders (VAEs), Diffusion Models, and more. The course covers both basic and advanced topics in deep learning, and also includes presentations by students on relevant research papers.

responses: The goal of the class is to be inclusive and accessible to all students, regardless of any disabilities. If a student experiences barriers to full participation or fair evaluation due to a disability, they should inform the instructor so that accommodations can be made. It is also important to inform the instructor early on in the quarter to ensure that appropriate accommodations can be provided. If there are any other obstacles to full participation, students are encouraged to share their concerns with the instructor.
